Primary Contact: Mary Beth Rutherford, Minds in Motion Coordinator, North & Central Okanagan; Email: mrutherford@alzheimerbc.org
Alternate Contact: Carly Gronlund, Support & Education Coordinator, First Link, North & Central Okanagan; Email: cgronlund@alzheimerbc.org
Primary Executive: Maribeth Friesen, Manager, North & Central Okanagan; Email: mfriesen@alzheimerbc.org
Service Details: - Offers a physical fitness and social program for people experiencing early memory loss due to Alzheimer’s disease or a related dementia with a friend, family member or care partner - Participants will stay physically active, meet and socialize with others living with dementia, get involved in activities such as ping pong, bingo, or other games, and have access to information about dementia and services as needed - The first component is a 45-minute low-impact fitness class lead by a fitness instructor - The staff and volunteers from the Alzheimer Society of BC welcome participants to social/activity time with light refreshments in the second part of the program
Eligibility: This program is designed for people with early symptoms of Alzheimer’s disease or a related dementia, such as memory loss, confusion, communication difficulties and changes in mood and behaviour, and is intended to be enjoyed with a care partner
How to Apply: Registration occurs through the recreation centres where Minds in Motion takes place.  We encourage you to attend a trial session prior to registering.For additional information, please email or phone
Meetings: Kelowna Mon, 1:15pm - 3pmParkinson Recreation Centre @ 1800 Parkinson WayVernon Thu, 10am - 11:30am Vernon Recreation Centre @ 3310 37th AvePentictonTue, 1:30 - 3:00pmPenticton Community Centre @ 325 Power St.
